description.narrative: The objective is to strengthen the conservation, protection, and management of key marine biodiversity areas by bringing a comprehensive, adequate, and resilient sample of marine biodiversity under protection in Marine PAs and MPA networks.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative:
1. Number of new agreements signed and existing agreements updated with country and Non-country partners, and regional and international organizations, donors and corporate sector.
2. Number of national governments and local governments adopting coastal and ocean policy, and implementing national SDS-SEA implementation plans, including supporting legislation and institutional arrangements
3. Number of countries and local governments mainstreaming national SDS-SEA/ICM programs into development and investment plans
4. Extent to which PEMSEA's operational funding is covered by sustainable financing mechanisms and partnership arrangements / Suite of products, services, funding mechanisms and partnership arrangements adopted and implemented in collaboration with Partners, Sponsoring Organizations, donors and private sector/business community (2015)
5. Percent of healthy and resilient coastal/watershed habitats with effective and sustainable management systems in place up are increased to 20%
6. Extent to which participating countries implementing ICM programs provide evidence of: a) improved management effectiveness, sustainability and benefits from CUZ/MSP and other relevant management tools and processes for healthy and resilient ecosystem products and services and addressing CCA and DRR; b) harmonize access to marine space by established economic sectors; c) assess costs and benefits in order to clearly understand socio-economic and ecological trade-offs; and d) extend governance principles to be more inclusive of weaker disadvantaged sectors, addressing issues of tenure and user-based rights.
7. Extent to which conservation focused ICM pilot demonstration projects result in measurable improvements in the areal extent, health and resiliency of habitats.
8. Number of additional countries with increased proportion of fishing grounds with reductions in overexploitation of fisheries and improved incomes for fishers' households
9. Number of priority river basin

comment.narrative:
1. 6 Agreements
2. 2 countries (Japan, RO Korea) and 2 local governments (Xiamen, China; Chonburi, Thailand)
3. 3 (China, Japan, RO Korea) and 2 two local governments (Xiamen, China; Chonburi, Thailand)
4. Not Adequate - around 90% is from GEF
5. About 12% (27,245 km) of region's coastline covered by ICM
6. Not Adequate
7. Not Adequate
8. In place in 4 countries (Cambodia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam)
9. 2 Jiulong River; Ciliwung River
10. Not Adequately - Limited National program or plan for CCA in place in 7 countries. Limited information on vulnerability assessment, including socio-economic risks and impacts
11. PSHEMS recognition achieved in 3 international ports (Bangkok, Laemchabang, Tanjung Pelepas)
12. Not Adequately - only limited government policies/regulations facilitate investment by the business sector in sustainable development of the coastal and marine economy
13. Not Adequately. - only 3 out of 8 countries are implementing ICM programme with SOC reporting
14. 600 individuals trained
15. Adequately - joint initiatives of PEMSEA and IW Learn upscaled
16. 3 QPRs and 1 APR
17. Adequately - PEMSEA Resource Facility to implement the project

1. 8 agreements; 2. 8 countries, 8 local governments 3. 8 countries, 8 local governments 4. 50% share 5. 20% increase (45,000kms) 6. Adequate - all 8 countries have initiated ICM programs 7. Adequate - all 8 countries have ICM demonstration sites 8. 4 additional country 9. 4 additional river basins 10. Adequate - CCA plans reviewed and updated 11. Additional 3 ports 12. Adequate - investment mechanism are tested and implemented within ICM framework 13. Adequate - SOC reporting in all 8 countries implemented 14. 5,000 15. Adequate - exchanges between IW learn and PEMSEA in knowledge sharing upscaled 16. 3, 1 17. Largely Adequate.

1. 8 agreements; 2. 4 countries, 8 local governments 3. 7 countries, 8 local governments 4. Not Adequate - remains at 10% share 5. 20% increase (45,000kms) 6. Adequate - all 8 countries have initiated ICM programs 7. Adequate - all 8 countries have ICM demonstration sites 8. 3 additional country 9. 2 additional river basins 10. Adequate - CCA plans reviewed and updated 11. Additional 3 ports 12. Not Adequate - investment mechanism are not yet tested and implemented within ICM framework 13. Adequate - SOC reporting in all 8 countries implemented 14. more than 5,000 15. Adequate - exchanges between IW learn and PEMSEA in knowledge sharing upscaled. EAS Congress manifested this. 16. 3, 1 17. Largely Adequate.
